Topic.Title: Yahoo! upgraded to Buy from Hold at Stifel Nicolaus

Message.Msg: Stifel Nicolaus’s Jordan Rohan raised his rating on the stock to Buy from Neutral, with a $25 price target, writing that even without a “meaningful” revival in the core business, “We believe at its current buyback rate, Yahoo! should be valued in the mid-$20s before year-end and even higher after the Asian assets are monetized.”

Message.Title: Stifel Nicolaus’s Jordan Rohan raises Yahoo! to Buy from Neutral, with a $25 price target
Message.Msg: Shares of Yahoo! are up 2 cents at $19.78 in early trading after Stifel Nicolaus’s Jordan Rohan raised his rating on the stock to Buy from Neutral, with a $25 price target, writing that even without a “meaningful” revival in the core business, “We believe at its current buyback rate, Yahoo! should be valued in the mid-$20s before year-end and even higher after the Asian assets are monetized.”

Message.Title: Yahoo Best Way To Participate In The Alibaba IPO
Message.Msg: YHOO has retained a 20% share in Alibaba, and provides an investor a way to indirectly participate in the Alibaba IPO. Currently Alibaba is valued at $38 billion. YHOO is currently worth $23 billion; $8.3 billion or 36% of its capitalization is the after-tax worth of their Alibaba holdings and net cash from their recent sale. Remove the Alibaba contributions, and YHOO is really worth $14.7 billion. A solid IPO could easily move the stock price of YHOO.

Topic.Title: Yahoo Best Way To Participate In The Alibaba IPO

Message.Msg: Stop the SeekingAlpha articles! If the Alibaba IPO is going to be the BIGGEST of the year or perhaps DECADE do you really think the average investor won't have access to it? That being said why would a person who wants to participate through ADR's forgo 100% of AG's movement for a company that only gets 20% of its movement. How did Alibaba Group fall as just last month were articles saying it was worth $50B-$60B? That's the problem when you post OPINIONS of nobodies from SeekingAlpha. A "smart investor" would buy the AG shares outright even phantom buy every penny, nickel or dime if need be but not through Yahoo. EMC owns 85% of VMware and that stock hasn't did anything whereas VMware has been all over the place.($120 down to $20 back up to $120 again in the last 5yrs.). EMC is like Yahoo, no higher than it was 5yrs ago.

Message.Title: Ali Baba investment?
Message.Msg: Excerpt from Article 2/4/13: YHOO has retained a 20% share in Alibaba, and provides an investor a way to indirectly participate in the Alibaba IPO. Currently Alibaba is valued at $38 billion. YHOO is currently worth $23 billion; $8.3 billion or 36% of its capitalization is the after-tax worth of their Alibaba holdings and net cash from their recent sale. Remove the Alibaba contributions, and YHOO is really worth $14.7 billion. A solid IPO could easily move the stock price of YHOO. How then would an investor take advantage of this situation? • Understand the valuations. Alibaba is currently valued at $38 billion. If the initial press releases regarding the IPO point to a higher valuation, expect the price of YHOO to respond accordingly. If the valuation is less than $38 billion, it may be best to wait until after the IPO and buy Alibaba in the open market. • If the investor is confident that the Alibaba IPO is going to be the next Chipotle (CMG) or Google (GOOG), they may want to either buy YHOO directly, or buy call options on YHOO.

Topic.Title: Dan Loeb selling again?

Message.Msg: Selling to balance does make me wonder???? Why sell to balance, why not enjoy the gain and buy more if you think that it is still a great investment. I believe his other big holdings are AIR and AAPL. From an investor standpoint, AAPL has been a dog for the past 4 months. Why increase your relative position in AAPL at this point? Perhaps, it is something else all together....a new company that he his moving money into? In any case, the underlying reasons for his selling should be evaluated to get an idea of what will happen next for YHOO. He is on the board, he is privy to what is happening inside the board, and he is no longer actively adding shares but rather, is selling shares???????? FYI I remain long Yhoo and will buy more if it drops a bit more.

Message.Title: 4th Quarter and Year-end results
Message.Msg: ..Yahoo! Reports Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2012 Results ...... SUNNYVALE, Calif.--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- Yahoo! Inc. (YHOO) today reported results for the fourth quarter and full year ended December 31, 2012. Q4 2012 Full Year 2012 GAAP revenue $1,346 million $4,987 million Revenue ex-TAC $1,221 million $4,468 million GAAP income from operations $190 million $566 million Non-GAAP income from operations $283 million $825 million GAAP net earnings per diluted share $0.23 $3.28 Non-GAAP net earnings per diluted share $0.32 $1.17 “I'm proud of Yahoo!'s 2012 and fourth quarter results. In 2012, Yahoo! exhibited revenue growth for the first time in 4 years, with revenue up 2 percent year-over-year,” said Yahoo! CEO Marissa Mayer. "During the quarter we made progress by growing our executive team, signing key partnerships including those with NBC Sports and CBS Television, and launching terrific mobile experiences for Yahoo! Mail and Flickr. At the same time, we achieved tremendous internal transformation in the culture, energy and execution of the Company." GAAP revenue was $1,346 million for the fourth quarter of 2012, a 2 percent increase from the fourth quarter of 2011. Revenue excluding traffic acquisition costs (“revenue ex-TAC”) was $1,221 million for the fourth quarter of 2012, a 4 percent increase compared to the fourth quarter of 2011. GAAP revenue was $4,987 million for the full year of 2012, flat compared to the prior year. Revenue ex-TAC was $4,468 million for the full year of 2012, a 2 percent increase from the prior year. Adjusted EBITDA for the fourth quarter of 2012 was $509 million, an 8 percent increase from the same period of 2011. Adjusted EBITDA was $1,699 million for the full year of 2012, a 3 percent increase from the prior year. GAAP inc

Topic.Title: Stifel Nicolaus’s Jordan Rohan raises Yahoo! to Buy from Neutral, with a $25 price target

Message.Msg: Someone just bought and someone sold 1,000,000 shares of Yahoo in the mid-19's in after-market today. Yhoo is a $25 stock for many, many reasons (without being an aquisition) all on its own. It has the second largest Unique Vistors (after Facebook) who actually stay on the site (Financials, Sports, Mail, More) in the world and advertisers love that. FaceBook has hundreds of millions of UV's but a great swath are in third world countries and don't "buy" thing advertisers sell. Yahoo has the audience advertisers want. Yahoo just needs to mobilize faster and faster. Marissa is a great CEO. Add the Alibaba, Yahoo Japan and buybacks of stock and this is a simply great stock to own and hang onto and thereby enjoy the lower long-term taxable income gain as it climbs to the mid-twenties. It's a no-brainer. If you are a trader, then there are probably better stocks to dip in and out of or to play options with. But long term money? I'm there. Finally, Yahoo will be bought by one of the usual suspects and when one makes a move, the others will want to as well, making a bidding war inevitable. And the stock will skyrocket so quickly it will be too late to get on board once that train leaves the station. Yahoo is the prettiest girl in the bar and it's closing time.

It has been increasing since September 19th (positive slope), but will turn down (negative slope) at the close on Wednesday at the lastest.

Topic.Title: What is 35% of Yahoo! Japan and 24% of Alibaba Group worth?

Message.Msg: I thnk there has been a price established by alibaba itself. I think 20% for $8 billion is what they are willing to pay. They must think that is a fair value. Now that makes it at least $16 billion with your own count. Add a 20% premium and $20 billion doesn't seem like a fantasy.

Topic.Title: YHOO slices through 50 day MA. Bearish sign. Get out and then back in at 17.

Message.Msg: You certainly justified your approach to investing in Yahoo--IMO we see YHOO up on Tuesday to $ 19.78-$ 19.90 levels

Topic.Title: YHOO slices through 50 day MA. Bearish sign. Get out and then back in at 17.

Message.Msg: maybe. If so short more. It will not go down every day but the fact remains it is under pressure and will retract in price for about a month or so and form a new base on top of the old base. We are now in the downslope of the new base and it has a little ways down to go. Downside is limited to 16.50 due to chatter about IPO a few years down the road. If you get in around 17 expect a move back up to 21-22 by the end of the year or mid 2014. So a nice return can be had with extreme patience. But if YHOO doesn't get back on track in the next few quarters even the Alibaba money may not help it go up. It may only tread water in that case.

Topic.Title: Yahoo should buy Blackberry.

Message.Msg: How's the Nokia marriage working for MSFT? As for "balls", why would you spend billions buying a company that if the Z10 and Q10 fail than the company is done for? Whether, the BB10 series takes off IDK, the reviews have been good but in a market where its Iphone or Android, Blackberry might be too little too late. Way too risky to bet on a one horse company...what happens if BB11 blows?
